abstracts.cdata!:
Ratings for the Yogyakarta and Central
            Java Earthquake Roof Structure Project for Indonesia were as
            follows: outcomes were satisfactory, the risk to development
            outcome was low or negligible, the Bank performance was
            satisfactory, and the Borrower performance was also
            satisfactory. Some lessons learned included: although the
            Java Reconstruction Fund (JRF) Roof Structure Project (RSP)
            successfully achieved its development objective; it will
            have been structured and implemented much differently if the
            actual level of need had been more accurately estimated
            prior to inception. Specifically, the estimated gap in
            coverage of housing need required a response that was beyond
            the capacity of any one agency, so both International
            Organization for Migration (IOM) and Cooperative Housing
            Foundation (CHF) International were contracted to build roof
            structures. In actuality, however, the level of need was low
            enough to easily be covered by only one group.
